alert.note: Alert for Benton; Lafayette; Marshall; Pontotoc; Tippah; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 03 at 8:22AM CST until January 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lafayette County in northwestern Mississippi... Union County in northeastern Mississippi... Northwestern Pontotoc County in northeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Marshall County in northwestern Mississippi... Southwestern Tippah County in northeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Benton County in northeastern Mississippi... * Until 900 AM CST. * At 822 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Holly Springs National Forest, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oxford, New Albany, Ripley, Holly Springs National Forest, Blue Mountain, Cambridge, Keownville, Bethlehem, Etta, Burgess, Denmark, Pinedale, Thaxton, Hickory Flat, Myrtle, Dumas, Abbeville, Taylor, Shari and Keel. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Lafayette; Marshall; Pontotoc; Tippah; Union
